gpt_university_description: University College Dublin (UCD) is a research-intensive public university located in Dublin, Ireland. Founded in 1854, it is one of the oldest and largest universities in the country. UCD offers a wide range of undergraduate and postgraduate programs in various fields including business, law, arts, engineering, and sciences.
gpt_location_cost_of_living: Dublin has a relatively high cost of living compared to other European cities, with housing, transportation, and food expenses being the primary contributors.
gpt_location_weather: Dublin experiences a maritime temperate climate characterized by mild winters and cool summers. The city has relatively consistent rainfall throughout the year, with relatively rare occurrences of snow or extreme temperatures.
gpt_location_description: Dublin, the capital city of Ireland, is a vibrant and culturally rich destination. Known for its historic architecture, lively pubs, and extensive arts scene, Dublin offers residents and visitors a wide range of activities and attractions. The city is also home to several multinational companies, creating a diverse and dynamic environment.
gpt_location_crime: Dublin has a moderate crime rate. Most crimes tend to be non-violent property crimes such as theft and burglary. However, it is recommended to take normal precautions and remain aware of your surroundings while exploring the city.
gpt_location_transportation: Dublin has a well-developed public transportation network including buses, trams (Luas), and suburban trains (DART). The city is also bicycle-friendly with cycling infrastructure and bike-sharing schemes.
